metadata.title: CVE-2021-47503 linux
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:  scsi: pm80xx: Do not call scsi_remove_host() in pm8001_alloc()  Calling scsi_remove_host() before scsi_add_host() results in a crash:   BUG: kernel NULL pointer dereference, address: 0000000000000108  RIP: 0010:device_del+0x63/0x440  Call Trace:   device_unregister+0x17/0x60   scsi_remove_host+0xee/0x2a0   pm8001_pci_probe+0x6ef/0x1b90 [pm80xx]   local_pci_probe+0x3f/0x90  We cannot call scsi_remove_host() in pm8001_alloc() because scsi_add_host() has not been called yet at that point in time.  Function call tree:    pm8001_pci_probe()   |   `- pm8001_pci_alloc()   |  |   |  `- pm8001_alloc()   |     |   |     `- scsi_remove_host()   |   `- scsi_add_host()
